Description: Rim fragment of pottery plate; white slip. Inside, black band on lip; on floor, frieze with lotus flowers (with added red) alternating with large filling ornaments. Outside reserved.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the provenance see the clay analysis quoted in Schlotzhauer 2012, 178.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 222, no. 90)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 177-8, Nau 149, pl. 33a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (IA.33)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4689 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
